definition: Chinese centered dot mark · (punct. used to separate Western names or words)
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
Chinese guillemet 《》(punct. used for names of books etc)
Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
dash/Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)
Chinese underdot (punct. used for emphasis, sim. to Western italics)
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
